title: Sources: 2-game ban expected for U-M's Moore
content: Michigan football coach Sherrone Moore is expected to be suspended for two games for the upcoming 2025 season as part of self-imposed sanctions by the university for the Connor Stalions advanced scouting scandal, industry sources told ESPN.

title: Source: Washington, D.C., to host 2027 NFL draft
content: The 2027 NFL draft will be held in Washington, D.C., on the National Mall, a source told ESPN, confirming an Axios report.

title: Browns LB Bush arrested, charged with assault
content: Browns linebacker Devin Bush has been arrested and charged with simple assault and harassment in Pennsylvania, according to court records.

title: Jets' 'thrilling' rally bounces Blues in Game 7
content: Trailing 3-1 in the third period of Game 7 at home, the top-seeded Jets rallied to stun the Blues 4-3 in double overtime, securing a victory in their first-round series and a second-round date with the Stars.

title: Warriors credit meeting for sparking Game 7 win
content: A day after an emotional players-only meeting, Buddy Hield became an unlikely playoff hero for the Warriors, leading the team early in Game 7 against the Rockets before Stephen Curry took over late.

title: Haliburton carves through Cavs in Game 1 stunner
content: The Pacers used a barrage of 3-pointers and a 22-point, 13-assist effort from Tyrese Haliburton to stun the top-seeded Cavaliers 121-112.

title: Alexander-Arnold to leave Liverpool after season
content: Trent Alexander-Arnold will leave Liverpool on a free transfer this summer, with sources telling ESPN he rejected a massive pay deal at Anfield.

title: IOC replaces Hall's 10 medals lost in L.A. fires
content: Five-time Olympic swimming champion Gary Hall Jr. received replicas of his 10 medals from the Games on Monday after the originals were destroyed during the Los Angeles wildfires in January.

title: üíç Eagles' Brown gets some Legend-ary help
content: The Philadelphia Eagles wide receiver will don his second ring in a several month stretch after helping the Eagles win Super Bowl LIX in February.

title: Who are the NBA's playoff MVPs? Ranking the top 10 on our evolving list
content: Who has dominated the postseason thus far? Chris Herring unveils his top 10 playoff MVPs, a list packed with star power and surprises.

title: SGA, Nikola Jokic and why this should be an epic, polite MVP clash
content: Both players have had historic, unprecedented seasons. Gilgeous-Alexander could win his first MVP, Jokic his fourth -- but neither is keen to campaign for it.

title: Stanley Cup playoffs daily: Round 2 begins with Maple Leafs-Panthers Game 1
content: The 16-team playoff field has been cut in half. Here's what to watch next, along with three stars of Round 1.

title: New NFL Power Rankings poll: How all 32 teams stack up after the draft
content: Our panel of experts ranked every NFL team from 1 to 32. Which franchises improved with their draft picks and offseason moves?

title: NFL experts debate the draft: What were the best -- and most puzzling -- picks?
content: Great value on Malaki Starks? Reach on Isaac TeSlaa? We asked 17 experts to weigh in on the NFL draft.

title: How Liverpool move on from Alexander-Arnold, as Real Madrid move nears
content: Trent Alexander-Arnold will leave Liverpool on a free transfer in the summer but how can the Premier League champions replace him?

title: Kane's trophy pain: Bayern title ends long wait for silverware
content: It's finally over! Bayern Munich have won the Bundesliga, which means Harry Kane finally has a trophy.

title: Kane's long trophy wait ends as Bayern win title
content: Bayern Munich clinched their 33rd Bundesliga title on Sunday, giving forward Harry Kane the first major trophy of his senior career.

title: Mourinho silent on future as Fener title hopes fade
content: Jos√© Mourinho refused to confirm whether he will remain at Fenerbahce next season after Sunday's defeat to Besiktas left them adrift in the title race.

title: Kroos: Pedri 'more important' to Bar√ßa than Yamal
content: Former Real Madrid player Toni Kroos believes Barcelona's Pedri is the best midfielder in the world and more important to his team than Lamine Yamal, Robert Lewandowski and Raphinha.

title: CAS to rule in Le√≥n's Club World Cup dispute
content: A verdict is expected Tuesday in Liga MX club Le√≥n's legal dispute with FIFA over entry to the Club World Cup in the United States next month.

title: Palmer hits back at online 'idiots' as Chelsea win
content: Cole Palmer hit back at social media "idiots" after ending his goal drought in Chelsea's 3-1 win over Liverpool on Sunday.

title: Ancelotti: Cl√°sico will be 'almost' decisive for title
content: Carlo Ancelotti said next weekend's Cl√°sico will be "almost" decisive in the LaLiga title race after Real Madrid beat Celta Vigo 3-2 on Sunday.

title: Bar√ßa's Lewandowski set to return against Inter
content: Robert Lewandowski has recovered from a hamstring injury and been included in Barcelona's squad for Tuesday's Champions League semifinal second leg against Inter Milan.

title: Haeran Ryu goes wire-to-wire in LPGA's return to Utah
content: Haeran Ryu made an 8-foot eagle putt during a flawless back nine that allowed her to pull away Sunday with an 8-under 64, giving her a five-shot victory at the inaugural Black Desert Championship in the LPGA Tour's return to Utah after a 61-year absence.

title: Joey Logano gets first win this season in OT at Texas
content: Reigning Cup champion Joey Logano surged ahead on the restart in overtime Sunday to win in the 11th race this year

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal, Man City battle for Rodrygo
content: Arsenal and Manchester City are both interested in signing Real Madrid forward Rodrygo. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Draft tiers at guard
content: Eric Moody goes through the different tiers at the guard position to help you in your 2025 fantasy women's basketball draft.

title: Hunter Brown leads all fantasy pitchers? Eugenio Suarez ends up a top-50 hitter? Don't be surprised
content: Eric Karabell looks into the crystal ball to tell fantasy baseball managers what might come to pass in the not-too-distant future.

title: Stanley Cup playoff odds: Panthers favorites, but field is tightly packed
content: Every playoff team's odds to win the 2025 Stanley Cup and favorites for the Conn Smythe Trophy for playoff MVP.

title: Kirst, Kavanagh or English? Paul Carcaterra's big board for the 2025 PLL draft
content: ESPN's Paul Carcaterra ranks the 2025 PLL draft's top prospects and matches teams up with players who best fit their needs.

title: Six-day forensic workshops get under way in A.P.
content: New norms related to handling of medical reports, evidence gathering, protection of crime scene and other aspects will be explained to police officers and forensic experts in the workshops

title: Congress MP Gaurav Gogoi met Pakistan Army official, says Assam CM
content: The Congress MP hit back, seeking an apology from Himanta Biswa Sarma for saying women in Assam would compromise to secure a job

title: Renovated Nagapattinam Railway Station building to be ready next month
content: Nearly 90% of the construction work has been completed and the project, according to officials; passenger amenities expected to be better in the new building.

title: Deliver all government services through the Mana Mitra WhatsApp platform, Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister directs officials
content: Expedite formation of date lake and use of drones to provide better services to citizens, Naidu tells officials at a review meet

title: The Hindu Huddle on Campus | Being there for a friend in mental distress is important, say students
content: At The Hindu Huddle on Campus: India in Dialogue, held at VIT Chennai on Monday (May 5, 2025), students emphasised the importance of staying connected with their friends in real time

title: Citing incomplete information, scientists urge APPCB to defer public hearing for TGV SRAAC expansion unit
content: The Environmental Impact Assessment report has not provided comprehensive details about various greenhouse gas emissions, says an NGO in a letter

title: Strong wind, heavy rain damage banana crop damaged in parts of Thanjavur, Mayiladuthurai districts
content: Farmers said poovan banana plants ready for harvest on hundreds of acres in Thiruvaiyaru, Thillaisthanam, Perumpuliyur, Kaduveli, Panaiyur, Aachanur, Vadugakudi, and Konerirajapuram were damaged in rain

title: Rahul Gandhi At PM Modi's Office For Meeting On New CBI Chief
content: Rahul Gandhi has arrived at Prime Minister Narendra Modi's office for a meeting on the new CBI chief.

title: Karnataka Begins Survey Of Scheduled Castes To Collect Empirical Data
content: A survey on SC sub-classification in the state has begun and will go on till May 17, Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah said on Monday.

title: IIITDM Jabalpur Student Films Roommate In Hostel Bathroom, Detained: Cops
content: A B Tech student at prestigious IIITDM Jabalpur in Madhya Pradesh was detained by police on Monday for allegedly filming her senior roommate in the hostel's bathroom, officials said.

title: 311 To Be Unified Helpline Number For Civic Complaints: Delhi Minister
content: Delhi PWD Minister Parvesh Verma on Monday said that the government is close to adopting unified helpline number '311' for registration of civic complaints related to NDMC, MCD, DDA, Jal Board and public works and flood control departments.

title: Global Airlines Take Longer Routes To Avoid Pak Airspace Amid Rising Tensions
content: Leading global airlines Air France and Lufthansa have stopped flying over Pakistani airspace to ensure safety of the flights amid rising tensions in the region, after the Pakistan-sponsored terror attack claimed the lives of 26 people in J&K.

title: Pakistani Man Arrested While Trying To Cross Into India Near Gurdaspur In Punjab
content: A man from Pakistan was arrested last night in Punjab's Gurdaspur while trying to cross the International Border illegally. The 24-year-old man was caught by the Punjab Police.

title: White House Shares AI Image Of Trump As Muscular Jedi On Star Wars Day
content: The White House has shared an AI-generated image of President Donald Trump as a muscular Jedi, in celebration of Star Wars Day, also known as "May, the 4th."

title: Lufthansa To Emirates: International Airlines Shun Pakistan Airspace Amid India Tensions
content: Amid increasing tension between New Delhi and Islamabad following a terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam, several international airlines are avoiding Pakistani airspace, according to airlines' statements and flight tracker data.

title: Putin's "Full Support" To PM Modi As Pak Seeks Russia Role In Pahalgam Probe
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin dialled Prime Minister Narendra Modi today and strongly condemned the terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam, where 25 tourists and a Kashmiri were shot dead in cold blood.

title: 7-Year-Old Dies Of Rabies Despite Vaccine In Kerala, 3rd Case In Month
content: A seven-year-old girl who contracted rabies despite receiving vaccination after the dog bite, died at a state-run hospital on Monday, family sources said.

title: Travel Vlogger Hospitalised After "Grossest" Train Journey In India
content: US Traveller Nick Maddock's 15-hour train journey from Varanasi to New Jalpaiguri turned traumatic after he was hospitalised with a severe respiratory infection.

title: BJP MP's "Dil Ke Armaan" Quip After Supreme Court Rejects Contempt Plea
content: BJP MP Nishikant Dubey, who recently targeted the Supreme Court after its order on the powers of the President and Governors, has now taunted the petitioner who filed a contempt plea against him.

title: India to become 4th largest economy in 2025, overtaking Japan
content: According to the IMF's World Economic Outlook April 2025, India is projected to become the fourth largest economy globally in 2025, surpassing Japan with a nominal GDP of $4,187.017 billion. The report indicates continued growth, forecasting India to overtake Germany by 2028 and achieve a $5 trillion economy by 2027.

title: Pahalgam attackers must be brought to justice, Putin tells PM Modi
content: President Vladimir Putin conveyed his condolences to Prime Minister Narendra Modi regarding the Pahalgam terror attack, assuring Russia's support in combating terrorism and emphasizing the need for justice. Both leaders affirmed their commitment to strengthening the India-Russia partnership.

title: Ray Dalio says Donald Trump‚Äôs tariff war is pushing America close to a recession
content: Ray Dalio, who predicted the 2008 crisis, warns that mishandled economic policies, particularly Trump's tariffs, could push the U.S. into a recession. He likens the tariffs' disruptive implementation to destabilizing the production system. Despite a tariff pause, Goldman Sachs estimates a significant chance of a recession within the next year, highlighting growing economic uncertainty.

title: 'Murshidabad violence was well planned,' claims Mamata; blames BSF & BJP
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee visited riot-affected Murshidabad, accusing the BJP-led Centre of instigating communal tensions. She alleged the BSF's actions escalated the violence and accused the BJP of forcibly relocating victims to prevent them from meeting her. Banerjee also criticized the NHRC's swift response to Murshidabad, questioning their absence in Manipur and Uttar Pradesh, suggesting a pre-planned conspiracy.

title: Real blow to Pakistan! India chokes $500 million goods via third countries
content: Following the Pahalgam attack, India has banned all imports from Pakistan, including indirect routes via intermediary nations, postal services, and vessels. This action, triggered by national security concerns, aims to prevent Pakistani goods from entering India through circumvention.

title: IPL 2025: Kagiso Rabada cleared to play, available for GT vs MI clash
content: South African fast bowler Kagiso Rabada is cleared to play again after completing a substance abuse treatment program. This followed a positive test for a recreational drug during the SA20 competition in January. SAIDS confirmed Rabada tested positive after a match on January 21 and was informed on April 1, leading to a provisional suspension.

title: Warren Buffet: I am somewhat embarrassed to say Apple CEO ‚Ä¶
content: Warren Buffett, the legendary investor, acknowledged Tim Cook's role in Berkshire Hathaway's success. He credited Apple's CEO for significant financial gains. Buffett announced his retirement at the annual meeting. This marked the end of an era. Greg Abel, the vice chairman, is set to succeed Buffett. Abel will lead Berkshire with a focus on long-term value.

title: CSK wicket-keeper ruled out of IPL 2025
content: Chennai Super Kings face a setback. Wicketkeeper Vansh Bedi is out of IPL 2025. Urvil Patel replaces him. Patel is a wicketkeeper-batter from Gujarat. He had strong domestic performances. CSK is already out of playoff contention. The team will focus on future rebuilding. Patel's addition offers a glimpse into the next generation. CSK will play final games with pride.

title: 'No help from government': MMA in Asian Games 2026 sparks concern
content: Mixed Martial Arts will debut at the 2026 Asian Games. India's athletes need government and sponsor support. Currently, there are no awards or government funding for training. India lacks a recognized federation to govern MMA. Ritu Phogat and Puja Tomar highlight the financial struggles. They emphasize the need for training centers and coaches.

title: Berkshire Hathaway board approves Greg Abel as CEO, backed by Warren Buffett
content: Berkshire Hathaway's board has officially named Greg Abel as the next CEO, succeeding Warren Buffett by the end of 2026. Abel, currently vice-chairman overseeing non-insurance operations, will navigate the $900 billion conglomerate through global economic challenges. Buffett, 94, will remain chairman to ensure continuity, expressing confidence in Abel's leadership to maintain Berkshire's success.

title: Elon Musk is no longer ‚ÄòElon Musk‚Äô on Twitter; changes his profile name to‚Ä¶
content: Elon Musk has once again altered his X display name, this time to 'Gorklon Rust,' sparking speculation about its meaning. The moniker appears to blend references to Grok, Musk's AI chatbot, and the Rust programming language, potentially linked to xAI's infrastructure.

title: BSF plans to deploy 17K troops, set up HQs at Pak & B'desh borders
content: The Border Security Force is set to bolster its operational capabilities with 16 new battalions, adding approximately 17,000 personnel. This expansion follows initial approval and includes establishing forward headquarters for western and eastern commands, overseeing the Pakistan and Bangladesh borders. The move addresses heightened security concerns, particularly after political shifts in Bangladesh and recent terror attacks.

title: Sonu Nigam responds to Kannada song row: I am entitled to take offence
content: Sonu Nigam is facing backlash in Karnataka after refusing to sing a Kannada song during his concert, sparking controversy and legal action

title: Unseasonal rains: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister directs officials to promtly pay compensation to affected farmers and lightning strike victims
content: Naidu tells officials to prevent losses by leveraging robust administrative and technical capabilities; officials submit preliminary reports on the crop damage to the Chief Minister

title: 3.17 lakh people sought treatment for dog bite cases in the State in 2024
content: Thiruvananthapuram district is way ahead of the other districts in the number of dog bite cases, with a total of 50,870 people seeking treatment. Kollam is in second place with 37,618 dog bite cases, Ernakulam had 32,086 cases, Palakkad had 31,303 cases and Thrissur 29,363 cases. Wayanad was last on the list with 5,719 cases.

title: The Hindu Huddle on Campus | Science or the arts: What does the world need today?
content: Moderated by Deputy Editor, The Hindu, R. Sujatha, the discussion began with students Pratibha V.B. and Vaishnvi M. giving their views on what both fields contribute to humanity and its development

title: Naidu likely to visit Uravakonda soon
content: The Chief Minister will be inaugurating the modernised canals of Handri Neeva Sujala Sravanthi project, according to officials

title: 170 girl students of MITS selected for AICTE scholarship
content: AICTE initiative supports meritorious students from economically weaker backgrounds; each student awarded ‚Çπ50,000, bringing the total scholarship amount to ‚Çπ85 lakh, says MITS principal

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Govt. high school in Hassan secures 100% results in SSLC examination for eighth consecutive year
content: Many parents prefer this school over private schools to ensure their children clear the SSLC examination

title: Announce timeline, details of caste survey; remove 50% cap on reservation: Congress
content: Calling the 50% cap on reservation ‚Äúthe biggest obstacle to social justice‚Äù, AICC SC Department head Rajesh Lilothia said the Congress wanted it to be abolished

title: Move to acquire fertile land for  university at Kumbakonam opposed
content: Farmers say they were surprised by the government‚Äôs move to acquire to 60 acres of land belonging to a trust at Kallapuliyur

title: "Demoralising": Top Court Summons Samay Raina, Others For 'Ridiculing' Disabled
content: The Supreme Court on Monday sought the presence of five social media influencers, including "India's Got Latent" host Samay Raina, on a plea of an NGO which alleged that they ridiculed persons with a rare disorder.

title: Noida Teen Found Hanging Inside Neighbour's House, Family Alleges Murder: Cops
content: A 14-year-old boy was found hanging from a ceiling fan at a neighbour's house in Noida, with his family alleging he was murdered by some local youths with whom he had an altercation two days ago, police said on Monday.

title: Putin Accepts PM Modi's Invitation To Visit India For Annual High-Level Meet
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin has accepted Prime Minister Narendra Modi's invitation to visit India for the annual high-level meeting as the two leaders held a telephone conversation on Monday, the Kremlin said.

title: 4 Killed, 6 Injured In Car-Bike Collision In Madhya Pradesh
content: Four lives were lost in a tragic accident when a car collided with a bike near Pidoura village on the Etawah-Uttar Pradesh highway that passes through Gwalior in Madhya Pradesh, leaving six others with severe injuries.

title: Hindu Monk Chinmoy Krishna Das Now Charged With Murder Of Chittagong Lawyer
content: Prominent Hindu leader and spokesperson for the Bangladesh Sammilito Sanatani Jagaran Jot, Chinmoy Krishna Das, was shown arrested on charges of the murder of Chittagong court lawyer Saiful Islam Alif by a local court.

title: US Climber Dies In Nepal While Trying To Scale World's 5th Highest Mountain
content: A US climber died attempting to scale the world's fifth-highest mountain, Makalu, his expedition organiser said Monday, the second death of this climbing season.

title: Indian Student Arrested In US For Impersonating Fed Agent To Scam Woman
content: A 21-year-old Indian student has been arrested in the US after trying to scam a 78-year-old woman from North Carolina by posing as a law enforcement officer.

title: Pak has more to lose than India: Moody's big warning
content: Moody's Ratings warns that ongoing tensions with India pose a greater economic risk to Pakistan than to India. Pakistan's growth and fiscal consolidation could be hampered, straining foreign-exchange reserves. India's economy remains robust, with minimal impact expected.

title: Pahalgam attack: Pakistan test-fires 2nd missile as tensions rise
content: Amidst heightened tensions following the Pahalgam terror attack, Pakistan conducted a test flight of its home-made Fatah missile, capable of striking targets up to 120 kilometers. This launch, part of Exercise INDUS, aimed to validate the weapon's design and performance.

title: Post IWT suspension, India begins expanding reservoir capacity in J&K
content: Amid escalating India-Pakistan tensions, India is enhancing storage capacity at two Kashmir hydroelectric facilities, marking its first action outside the Indus Waters Treaty after suspending it. Maintenance operations, including reservoir flushing to remove sediment, were conducted at the Salal and Baglihar projects.

title: India A likely to leave for England on May 25, BCCI begin process
content: India A is set to tour England, with the first batch of players departing on May 25, as arranged by the BCCI. They will play three four-day games against England Lions, starting May 30, before the Test series. Senior players may participate in an unofficial Test for acclimatisation, depending on IPL progress and medical clearance.

title: SC lists PIL challenging Waqf case for hearing on May 15 by next CJI
content: The Supreme Court has scheduled a hearing on May 15, before a bench led by CJI-designate B R Gavai, to address petitions challenging the constitutionality of the Waqf Amendment Act, 2025. This decision follows the Centre's pause on key aspects of the law and assurances given to the court regarding waqf property denotification and appointments to the Central Waqf Council.

title: Shubman Gill being groomed for Test captaincy?
content: The Indian selection committee, led by Ajit Agarkar, is set to announce the squad for the England tour in May, with captaincy a key point of discussion. While Rohit Sharma's recent performance and Jasprit Bumrah's injury raise questions, the BCCI is considering Shubman Gill for a leadership role, potentially as vice-captain.

title: Prabhsimran bats for ailing father, undergoing dialysis thrice a week
content: Prabhsimran Singh's explosive batting for Punjab Kings in the IPL is a source of joy for his ailing father, Surjit Singh, who is battling kidney failure. Despite his health struggles, Surjit finds solace and happiness in watching his son's performance. Prabhsimran has produced 437 runs in 11 innings for PBKS at a strike rate of 170.

title: 'Aim to get publicity': SC rejects PIL seeking safety, security of tourists in J&K
content: The Supreme Court reprimanded a petitioner for filing a Public Interest Litigation (PIL) seeking tourist safety in hilly areas from terrorist attacks, deeming it a publicity stunt without genuine public concern. The court questioned the petitioner's motives and cautioned against demoralizing security forces with frivolous PILs, highlighting the judiciary's lack of expertise in terror investigation.

title: Arshdeep Singh: The left-arm quick India need in England
content: With his skill to swing the ball both ways and his dexterity to hit the 6m length consistently, Arshdeep Singh is arguably the best of his type India has had since Zaheer Khan. The 26-year-old's opening spell against Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) is a gentle reminder to Ajit Agarkar and co. of why he should be on the plane for the five-match Test series against England, starting June 20.

title: ICC Rankings: India dominate white-ball formats, Australia top in Tests
content: India reigns supreme in ODI and T20I formats, securing the No. 1 spot in the latest ICC rankings, fueled by their Champions Trophy victory. New Zealand trails in ODIs, while Australia dominates the Test arena, despite a minor dip. England's Test resurgence propelled them to second, pushing India to fourth. The T20I rankings now encompass 100 teams, reflecting global participation.

title: Told not to honk, Thar driver drives over security guard in Delhi
content: The Delhi Police arrested 24-year-old Vijay alias Lale in a hit-and-run and attempt-to-murder case involving a security guard at Mahipalpur Flyover. The accused allegedly ran over the victim after an argument over honking. The victim sustained serious leg injuries. A Mahindra Thar, identified via CCTV, was seized, and the arrest was made within six hours of the incident.

title: Allahabad high court dismisses plea challenging Rahul Gandhi's citizenship
content: The Allahabad High Court has dismissed a petition questioning Congress MP Rahul Gandhi's Indian citizenship. A BJP worker from Karnataka, S Vignesh Shishir, filed the petition. He alleged Gandhi possessed dual citizenship, making him ineligible to contest elections. The court had previously granted the Home Ministry time to verify information from the UK.

title: Israel 'unanimously approves' plan which includes Gaza 'conquest': Official
content: Israel has formulated a new plan for Gaza, reportedly involving the territory's conquest and potential relocation of its population southward for safety. The Israeli security cabinet, led by Prime Minister Netanyahu, has approved the plan, aiming to defeat Hamas and secure the release of hostages. While Israel considers humanitarian aid distribution, concerns persist regarding the blockade's impact on Gaza's 2.

title: 'It stinks': Ex-Aus captain slams lack of transparency in Rabada drug case
content: Tim Paine has criticised the lack of transparency surrounding Kagiso Rabada's failed drug test, deeming the situation "extremely wrong." Paine argues that Rabada's positive test for a banned recreational substance during the SA20 league should not be concealed under "personal issues." He insists on public accountability, demanding clarity on the offence, punishment, and overseeing body.

title: Ajit Pawar ‚Äòstill waiting to be CM‚Äô, says no ‚Äòyog‚Äô till now
content: Ajit Pawar's decades-long pursuit of Maharashtra's Chief Minister post remains elusive, marked by missed opportunities and political calculations. Despite his ambition and numerous stints as Deputy CM, the coveted position has been consistently out of reach. Meanwhile, Deven Bharti's appointment as Mumbai's police commissioner presents the challenge of re-establishing the force's presence and leadership in the city.

title: Adani stocks surge up to 14% after reports of team meeting Trump officials
content: Adani Group stocks surged following reports of discussions between Gautam Adani's representatives and US officials regarding bribery charges. The talks aim to dismiss criminal charges related to alleged bribery in Indian power supply contracts.

title: 'Just wanted to open eyes': Cong's Ajay Rai defends 'toy Rafale' jibe at Centre
content: Uttar Pradesh Congress president Ajay Rai defended his "toy Rafale" jibe, clarifying it was to urge action against terrorism after the Pahalgam attack. Rai criticized the Defence Minister's symbolic gestures during the Rafale acquisition, demanding concrete action. BJP leaders strongly condemned Rai's remarks, accusing him of undermining military morale and aiding Pakistan, sparking a political controversy.

title: Revenge, rivalry, Rs 5L deal: Suhas Shetty murder linked to 2022 Fazil killing?
content: Police arrested eight individuals in connection with the murder of Suhas Shetty, revealing a revenge plot fueled by personal grudges. Abdul Safwan, targeted by Shetty's associates in 2023, allegedly orchestrated the murder with financial and logistical support from Adil Mehroof, whose brother was murdered in 2022, with Shetty named as an accused.

title: 'Punjab won't give single drop of water to Haryana': Resolution moved in Punjab Assembly
content: Punjab's Water Resources Minister Barinder Kumar Goyal, while reading out the resolution, said the BJP has been trying to take away the rights of Punjab through its governments in Haryana and at the Centre, and the Bhakra Beas Management Board (BBMB).

title: Union Minister Pralhad Joshi directs officials to complete sports complex in Hubballi in five months
content: Although Smart City scheme officials had promised to complete the work in the next two months, Union Minister told them to take five months, but complete all the work within that period, without fail

title: NIA conducts searches in Delhi, Haryana and Rajasthan in extortion bid case linked to Canada-based Arsh Dalla
content: The NIA took over the case in December, and seized several electronic devices and other incriminating materials during the searches conducted on the premises of the accused and suspects

title: Teen becomes first to clear class 10 exams in Uttar Pradesh village since independence
content: Ramkeval, a determined student from a small village, overcomes poverty to become the first class 10 pass in decades

title: CJI bows out of waqf case, skips decision on interim stay of 2025 law
content: Chief Justice of India Sanjiv Khanna hands over baton of the case to his successor designate B.R. Gavai to steer the course; the next hearing is on May 15¬†

title: T.N. CM Stalin presents royalties to families of five Tamil scholars whose works have been nationalised
content: While the family members of Abdul Rahman, Merwin, and Palani received the royalties from the Chief Minister, poets Ku. Ma. Kothandam and Ilama Tamilnavan received theirs in person

title: Sonu Nigam will not be invited to events, should apologise: Kannada film chamber
content: The Karnataka Film Chamber of Commerce has said that the association will not invite Sonu Nigam for any film-related activities and will take a call on his future in Sandalwood

title: Janakrosha Yatra of BJP to conclude in Hubballi on May 11
content: The ‚ÄòJanakrosha Yatra‚Äô was launched by the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) against the Congress government in Karnataka on the issues of price rise, diversion of funds for guarantee schemes and Muslim appeasement

title: Man held for attempt to murder in hit-and-run case in Delhi
content: 24-year-old man arrested for attempting to murder security guard by crushing him with SUV in southwest Delhi

title: Caste census: Andhra Pradesh BJP terms Centre‚Äôs decision as historic
content: The party‚Äôs Other Backward Classes Morcha‚Äôs former State president Jalli Madhusudhan called it a blessing for the oppressed communities

title: Putin speaks to PM Modi, says perpetrators of Pahalgam attack must be brought to justice
content: Mr. Putin accepts PM Modi‚Äôs invitation to visit India for the annual high-level meeting to be held in India later this year

title: Amended Waqf law will protect tribal lands: Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Vishnu Deo Sai
content: Chhattisgarh CM speaks in support of Waqf Act amendment to benefit Muslims and tribal communities; criticises Congress

title: Bengaluru police summon singer Sonu Nigam for questioning
content: Based on the complaint by a Kannada activist, the Avalahalli police charged Sonu Nigam under Sections 351 and 352 of Bharatiya Nyay Sanhita, 2023.

title: International university looking to set up campus in Tamil Nadu, says Palanivel Thiaga Rajan
content: Speaking at an industry event, the Minister said he attended a meeting with Chief Minister M.K. Stalin on Monday, wherein officials from the university had participated

title: SC rejects woman's plea claiming possession of Red Fort as legal 'heir'
content: The Supreme Court dismissed Sultana Begum's plea to reclaim the Red Fort, deeming her claim as the widow of Bahadur Shah Zafar II‚Äôs great-grandson misconceived and meritless. The court questioned why only the Red Fort was being claimed and not other historical sites. Begum argued her family was wrongfully deprived of the fort after the 1857 war of independence.

title: Indian student in US arrested for impersonating a 'federal agent' to dupe woman
content: Kishan Kumar Singh, an Indian student, was arrested in North Carolina for allegedly impersonating a federal agent. He is accused of scamming a 78-year-old woman by convincing her that her bank accounts were compromised. Singh is currently held on a $1 million bond, facing felony charges for his alleged crimes.

title: 'Maybe it‚Äôs time he says, Pooran, you take ...': Finch's bold advice for Pant
content: Aaron Finch suggests Rishabh Pant relinquish wicketkeeping to Nicholas Pooran to improve communication and leadership amid a poor IPL season. Pant's struggles with both batting and captaincy, highlighted by a slow scoring rate and on-field frustrations, are impacting LSG's performance. Finch believes this change could help Pant regain rhythm and directly manage the team's strategies, crucial for their playoff push.

title: Reliance Jio‚Äôs in-house 5G push threatens European telecom giants
content: Reliance Jio is strategically densifying its 5G network across India by deploying domestically manufactured network products, potentially slashing costs and reducing reliance on Ericsson and Nokia. This move involves utilizing 5G small cells produced near Chennai through a joint venture, enhancing coverage in urban areas. Jio's shift aims for self-reliance and optimized capital expenditure in its 5G expansion.

title: Pahalgam attack: IAF on alert, Rafales ready for swift strike as tensions soar
content: Amid escalating tensions, the IAF chief briefed PM Modi on operational readiness, including long-range fighter sorties and heightened air defense. This meeting, following a similar briefing from the Navy chief, underscores India's preparedness for potential punitive strikes against Pakistan. The IAF is conducting regular combat air patrols and increasing operational readiness platforms, with Rafales equipped for swift action.

title: 'IEDs packed in tiffin boxes, wireless sets seized': Terror hideout busted in Poonch
content: Security forces in Jammu and Kashmir's Poonch district discovered a large cache of arms and ammunition from a destroyed terrorist hideout, including IEDs and wireless sets. This discovery follows a recent deadly terror attack in Pahalgam, prompting heightened security measures across the state with increased checkpoints and deployments.

title: Indian Idol 12 winner Pawandeep Rajan injured in car accident
content: Singer Pawandeep Rajan, winner of Indian Idol Season 12, was critically injured in a car accident in Ahmedabad early Monday morning. The accident occurred around 3:40 a.m., leaving him with visible injuries. Fans are expressing their concern and sending wishes for his speedy recovery as they await official news regarding the cause of the accident and his current medical condition.

title: Gold prices off record highs; Gold June futures start higher today
content: Gold futures opened higher at Rs 93,271/10 grams, while silver saw a slight increase to Rs 94,145/kg. Prices previously declined due to optimism surrounding US-China trade talks and a stronger dollar.

title: 'Captain came up with the move': Ponting hails Shreyas' tactical call
content: Punjab Kings' head coach Ricky Ponting lauded Shreyas Iyer's captaincy, particularly the strategic promotion of Josh Inglis, which proved pivotal in their dominant victory against Lucknow Super Giants. Inglis' aggressive innings against Mayank Yadav shifted the momentum, while Prabhsimran Singh's explosive 91 and Arshdeep Singh's impactful bowling further solidified PBKS's win, propelling them to second place in the table.

title: 'My brother took up cause': Priyanka says govt 'pressured' for caste census
content: Priyanka Gandhi Vadra stated that the central government's agreement to include caste enumeration in the upcoming census is due to pressure, highlighting Rahul Gandhi's advocacy on the issue. Jairam Ramesh criticized PM Modi for a "U-turn" on the caste census, noting the government's prior opposition.

title: Google changes its appraisal program, VP to employees: "We want to be upfront that..."
content: Google is revamping its employee performance review system to reward top performers with increased bonuses and equity, aiming to incentivize high achievement across the company. To fund these enhanced rewards for those achieving "Outstanding Impact," the company will slightly reduce bonus and equity multipliers for employees with "Significant Impact" and "Moderate Impact" ratings, ensuring a budget-neutral adjustment.

title: Supreme Court says it will pass orders to dismiss PIL for contempt action against BJP MP Nishikant Dubey
content: Supreme Court declines PIL seeking contempt action against BJP MP for derogatory remarks, citing dignity of institution

title: India, Japan condemn terrorism in all forms: Rajnath Singh after talks with Japanese counterpart Gen Nakatani
content: Rajnath Singh said the Japanese Defence Minister expressed solidarity with India in the wake of the Pahalgam attack and offered ‚Äúfull support‚Äù to India; ‚ÄúBoth sides condemned terrorism in all forms and emphasised the need for enhanced collaboration and joint efforts to counter cross-border threats,‚Äù Mr. Singh said

title: Suhas Shetty murder: HJV demands NIA probe to unearth PFI role in fomenting terror in coastal Karnataka
content: It is not that Karnataka police are incompetent, but political leadership doesn‚Äôt allow them to conduct impartial probe, HJV leader K. T. Ullas

content: The BJP government had opened a ‚Äòrowdy sheet‚Äô against Suhas Shetty but is now attempting to glorify him as the saviour of Hindutva, says the MLC

content: Mr. Stalin said in a social media post: ‚ÄúMay Marx‚Äôs ideas cast their light upon the path of humanity.‚Äù

content: Observing that the fundamental right to freedom of speech and expression is not absolute, the Bench said no one can be allowed to demean anybody under the garb of the right and mulled framing guidelines on social media content concerning the disabled and people with rare disorders

title: 17-year-old boy murdered during temple festival at Kulithalai in Karur
content: The deceased R. Shyam Sundar,¬†of Kulithalai,¬†was a Class 12 student of a government higher secondary school

content: A Bench of Bela M. Trivedi and P.B. Varale directed the State Criminal Investigation Department (CID) to hand over the case papers to the DGP in two days

content: ‚ÄúThe notice was issued to Daitapati Nijog secretary and senior servitor Ramakrushna Dasmohapatra on the charge of ‚Äúcreating confusion in the minds of countless devotees and worshippers‚Äù of Lord Jagannath

title: Yuvraj Singh on his appreciation for Tequila, and the craftsmanship behind his spirit brand, FINO
content: FINO is a luxury sipping Tequila, and comes in varieties such as blanco, reposado, anejo and a ros√©-inspired rosado

title: Day before protest, several SKM leaders put under ‚Äòhouse arrest‚Äô in Punjab, say farmer leaders
content: The farmer leaders claimed that Punjab Police personnel reached their houses early morning to detain them; they said police wanted to prevent them from mobilising people for a protest on May 6, 2025

title: Committed to the implementation of internal reservation in Karnataka, survey to be held in three phases: CM Siddaramaiah
content: As statewide mapping of Scheduled Castes gets underway, CM urges people belonging to SC communities to come forth and provide data

title: SC peruses CFSL report on audio tapes allegedly featuring ex-Manipur CM Biren Singh, suggests fresh report
content: Advocate Prashant Bhushan, appearing for petitioner-NGO Kuki Organisation for Human Trust, referred to the prayer in the petition for a court-monitored investigation by a Special Investigation Team into leaked audio clips

title: NCW comes out in support of Pahalgam attack victim's wife over online trolling
content: The commission reminded citizens that "the dignity and respect of every woman is valuable" and calls for constructive and respectful expression during national grief

title: Supreme Court frowns upon Jharkhand HC for not pronouncing verdict in criminal cases, seeks report from all HCs
content: A report by the Registrar General of the Jharkhand High Court said verdict has not been pronounced despite order being reserved on 56 criminal appeals heard by division bench

title: Goa stampede: Police directives on CCTV cameras, barricades not implemented ahead of temple fest
content: The temple authorities said there wasn‚Äôt enough time to install the CCTV cameras, as the meeting was held just a couple of days before the event

title: World Bank executive director Parameswaran Iyer to represent India at IMF board
content: Parameswaran Iyer's nomination was necessitated to fill a vacancy created with the termination of services of K.V. Subramanian as the executive director at the IMF

title: Supreme Court junks plea of woman claiming possession of iconic Red Fort
content: Petitioner Sultana Begum claimed to be the widow of great-grandson of Mughal emperor Bahadur Shah Zafar-II

content: ‚ÄúI could have gone to Murshidabad earlier, but if there is no peace and stability there, we should not go and disturb,‚Äù said the Chief Minister

content: In the last hearing, the Centre assured the top court that it would neither denotify waqf properties, nor make any appointments to the Central Waqf Council and boards

title: Priyanka Gandhi welcomes Centre's announcement to conduct caste census
content: Ms. Gandhi said that pressure from people across the country seemed to have made a difference in the Government‚Äôs stance.

title: How coffee agroforests can play a role in ecological restoration
content: A recent study by the Nature Conservation Foundation, in collaboration with owners and managers of agroforests in Hassan and Chikkamagaluru districts, demonstrates the potential of coffee agrosystems as refuge for biodiversity

title: Shaping the port of the future¬†
content: The Vizhinjam port is of immense significance to India‚Äôs global maritime trade.¬†¬†Amongst all existing Indian ports, Vizhinjam is the closest to international shipping routes. Many global shipping stakeholders have already appreciated the role the port is going to play in transshipment

title: Pahalgam terror attack LIVE: Russian President Putin conveys full support to fight against terrorism; Japan expresses solidarity with India
content: In phone talks with PM Modi, Russian President Vladimir Putin says perpetrators of Pahalgam terror attack and their supporters must be brought to justice

title: BSF to get 16 new battalions, 2 field HQs for Pakistan, Bangladesh borders
content: The paramilitary force has 193 battalions as of now to guard the two fronts. A battalion of the border force consists of over 1,000 troopers. Hence, the overall strength of the 16 new battalions will be around 17,000 personnel

title: Heavy rain brings respite from heat, but throws life out of gear in Vijayawada
content: Collector ensures NEET aspirants did not face any transportation issue, urges people to stay cautious

title: Boy dies after falling into overflowing drain in Machavaram
content: The boy reportedly fell in an overflowing drain. Local residents and the boy‚Äôs mother noticed Manikanta in the drain and shifted him to hospital, where the doctors declared him as ‚Äòbrought dead‚Äô

title: Telangana¬†High Court judge Justice M.G. Priyadarsini passes away
content: The mortal remains of the judge were kept at Villa No. 14, Vasanth City, Hafeezpet. The last rites would be performed at 12 p.m. at Jubilee Hills Mahaprasthanam on May 5

title: Supreme Court to hear batch of pleas challenging Waqf (Amendment) Act today
content: The Centre assured the Supreme Court on April 17 that it would neither denotify waqf properties, including ‚Äòwaqf by user‚Äô, nor make any appointments to the Central Waqf Council and boards till May 5

title: Amid India-Pakistan tension, 30-minute blackout drill held at Ferozepur Cantonment¬†
content: The BSF has intensified patrolling along the international border while Punjab Police has set up checkpoints at all strategic locations as a precautionary measure

title: From health to depth to the entire offense: One thing that must change for all 30 MLB teams
content: Xavier Scruggs explains why the Cubs might need to be worried about their pitching . every team, no matter how splendid or how dreadful the start, has something to change . the national league looked top-heavy, and the overall dynamic is very much one of dominance .

title: A .423 average? Better advanced stats than Bonds!? Aaron Judge is putting up video game numbers
content: Aaron Judge is hitting an astounding .423/.510/.777 with 10 extra-base hits during his eighth-inning double Sunday . he leads the majors in batting average, on-base percentage, slugging percentage, OPS and hits .

title: West playoffs: Hield leads Golden State over Houston in Game 7
content: the 2024-25 playoffs are in full swing, and our NBA insiders have you covered for every game in the march to the finals . on friday, the No. 6 seed Minnesota Timberwolves pulled off an upset by eliminating the no. 3 seed Los Angeles Lakers in a Game 5 win .

title: How does the NHL draft lottery work? Everything you need to know
content: the no. 1 pick doesn't go to the team with the worst regular-season record . a lottery will determine the final order of the first 16 picks . the lottery gives multiple non-playoff teams the chance at getting the No.1 pick .

title: NBA conference semifinals: Pacers take Game 1 over the Cavaliers in Cleveland
content: the no. 4 Indiana Pacers beat the Cavaliers 121-112 in the Eastern and Western Conference semifinals . the playoffs take place on tuesday (7 p.m. ET, TNT) on monday, the No. 3 new york Knicks will travel to the no 2 Boston Celtics for Game 1 .

title: Biggest questions for Round 2 of the NBA playoffs
content: no. 1 Cleveland Cavaliers swept the Orlando Magic in the first round . they became the first team in the East to claim a spot in the conference semifinals . the playoffs will begin on tuesday in the second round of 2025 .

title: This time at UCF, Scott Frost won't need to catch lightning in a bottle
content: Scott Frost is reuniting with the UCF Knights as their new head coach . the Knights are now in a power 4 conference, and there is now a 12-team college football playoff . he is a new coach at the university of central Florida .

title: NBA playoff odds: Thunder, Celtics big favorites to win NBA title
content: the top-seeded Oklahoma City Thunder entered the playoffs as favorites to win the NBA championship . the Golden State Warriors and Houston Rockets are ties 3-3 in their first-round series and will play Game 7 on Sunday in Houston . in the east, the second round is set, as the defending champions Boston Celtics will face the new york Knicks .

title: Inoue won the weekend and proved once again he's must-see TV
content: Naoya Inoue beats Ramon Cardenas in the eighth round to retain his undisputed junior featherweight championship . the fight was supposed to be one of the biggest weekends in boxing had turned into a dud with top stars failing to impress . inoue's performance saved the weekend with an electrifying performance .
